bill.title: Office of Elections Package; Absentee Ballots; Electronic Transmission
bill.description: Allows a permanent absentee voter to temporarily receive a ballot at an alternate address for elections within an election cycle. Clarifies that certain conditions that normally lead to a termination of permanent absentee voter status do not apply if the voter resides in an absentee ballot only area. Replaces references to facsimile ballots with references to electronically transmitted ballots. Allows a voter to receive an absentee ballot by electronic transmission if the voter requires such a ballot within five days of an election, or the voter would otherwise not be able to return a properly issued ballot by the close of polls. (SD1)

history.action: The committee(s) on JDL has scheduled a public hearing on 01-29-16 9:00AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Shimabukuro, Gabbard, Kim; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) L. Thielen.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2012) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 02-11-16 9:30AM in conference room 211.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in WAM were as follows: 8 Aye(s): Senator(s) Tokuda, Dela Cruz, Chun Oakland, Inouye, Riviere, Taniguchi, Wakai, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) English, Galuteria, Harimoto.
Reported from WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2200) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading. Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Espero). Transmitted to House.
Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 20) in amended form (SD 1).
Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 19
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Thursday, 03-10-16 3:15PM in House conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, San Buenaventura, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, C. Lee, Morikawa, Nakashima, Takayama, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 4 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti, Kawakami, Woodson, McDermott.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1048-16), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.
Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Kawakami, Kong, Oshiro, Say, Souki, Tokioka excused (6).
